availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Moses Miller (Clinton County, Kentucky, farm laborer and deputy court clerk)

body.p: Clinton County, Kentucky, farm laborer and deputy court clerk. Kentucky native. Son of John Miller and Eliza Miller. Resident of Clinton County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farm laborer in Clinton County in 1860. Deputy county court clerk in Clinton County in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clinton County,/District 2, p. 209B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clinton County, p. 299-300.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Overton County, District 11, p. 365A.
"Moses V.B. Miller (1843-1902)," Find A Grave, Memorial #8862214, accessed September 22, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/8862214.
KYR-0001-017-0196.
